name: Ysph-thesis
tagline: MPH Thesis comparing deterministic and stochastic modeling methods when applied to school closings to prevent influenza transmission
body:
### Abstract
Specific Aims: Designing a model that informs policy makers when to close schools in order to prevent further flu transmission.

Hypotheses: Demonstrating that stochastic models are better are a better fit to predict possible flu epidemics in elementary schools than deterministic models.

### Background
Parameters:
R0 = {1.2,1.6,2.0}
Gamma = {2,5,8} days
Deterministic Method equations:
\frac{dS}{dt} = -\beta\frac{SI}{N} - \nu S
\frac{dI}{dt} = +\beta\frac{SI}{N} - \gamma I
\frac{dS}{dt} = +\gamma I
\frac{dV}{dt} = +\nu S
Stochastic Method: Gillespie Algorithm

### Methods
Stochastic vs Deterministic
